title: American_Top_40_1973_September_22nd
description:
"These are the most popular songs from Maine to Hawaii, from Alaska to Florida. My name is Casey Kasem and our countdown rolls on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

The band that recorded "The Lion Sleeps Tonight" lost a member and reformed under a new name. They finally have a song in the countdown that isn't annoying.

There is a band in the countdown that is enjoying their sixth million selling album.

There is a song in the countdown by the former rock 'n' roll star whose name inspired the fictional name of Conrad Birdie, the title character in the hit Broadway musical and motion picture, "Bye Bye Birdie."

Maureen McGovern is at number 26 with her first hit song, "The Morning After" from the motion picture, "The Poseidon Adventure."

There's a group in the countdown who just a few weeks prior, played to a crowd of 600,000 people. That's 1/350th of the US population at the time.

There is a woman on the chart who, just a week prior, helped break the record for most female singers hitting number one in a single year. The previous record stood for twenty one years. Casey gives the details.
